property.name: hbase.rootdir
property.description: The directory shared by region servers. Should be fully-qualified to include the filesystem to use. E.g: hdfs://NAMENODE_SERVER:PORT/HBASE_ROOTDIR

property.name: hbase.master
property.description: The host and port that the HBase master runs at. A value of 'local' runs the master and a regionserver in a single process.

property.name: hbase.master.info.port
property.description: The port for the hbase master web UI Set to -1 if you do not want the info server to run.

property.name: hbase.master.info.bindAddress
property.description: The address for the hbase master web UI

property.name: hbase.client.write.buffer
property.description: Size of the write buffer in bytes. A bigger buffer takes more memory -- on both the client and server side since server instantiates the passed write buffer to process it -- but reduces the number of RPC. For an estimate of server-side memory-used, evaluate hbase.client.write.buffer * hbase.regionserver.handler.count

property.name: hbase.master.meta.thread.rescanfrequency
property.description: How long the HMaster sleeps (in milliseconds) between scans of the root and meta tables.

property.name: hbase.master.lease.period
property.description: HMaster server lease period in milliseconds. Default is 120 seconds. Region servers must report in within this period else they are considered dead. On loaded cluster, may need to up this period.

property.name: hbase.regionserver
property.description: The host and port a HBase region server runs at.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.dns.interface
property.description: Name of the network interface which a regionserver should use to determine it's "real" IP address. This lookup prevents strings like "localhost" and "127.0.0.1" from being reported back to the master.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.info.port
property.description: The port for the hbase regionserver web UI Set to -1 if you do not want the info server to run.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.info.bindAddress
property.description: The address for the hbase regionserver web UI

property.name: hbase.regionserver.class
property.description: An interface that is assignable to HRegionInterface. Used in HClient for opening proxy to remote region server.

property.name: hbase.client.pause
property.description: General client pause value. Used mostly as value to wait before running a retry of a failed get, region lookup, etc.

property.name: hbase.client.retries.number
property.description: Maximum retries. Used as maximum for all retryable operations such as fetching of the root region from root region server, getting a cell's value, starting a row update, etc. Default: 10.

property.name: hbase.client.scanner.caching
property.description: Number of rows that will be fetched when calling next on a scanner if it is not served from memory. Higher caching values will enable faster scanners but will eat up more memory and some calls of next may take longer and longer times when the cache is empty.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.lease.period
property.description: HRegion server lease period in milliseconds. Default is 60 seconds. Clients must report in within this period else they are considered dead.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.handler.count
property.description: Count of RPC Server instances spun up on RegionServers Same property is used by the HMaster for count of master handlers. Default is 10.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.msginterval
property.description: Interval between messages from the RegionServer to HMaster in milliseconds. Default is 3 seconds.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.maxlogentries
property.description: Rotate the HRegion HLogs when count of entries exceeds this value. Default: 100,000. Value is checked by a thread that runs every hbase.server.thread.wakefrequency.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.flushlogentries
property.description: Sync the HLog to the HDFS when it has accumulated this many entries. Default 100. Value is checked on every HLog.append

property.name: hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval
property.description: Sync the HLog to the HDFS after this interval if it has not accumulated enough entries to trigger a sync. Default 10 seconds. Units: milliseconds.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.hlog.blocksize
property.description: Block size for HLog files. To minimize potential data loss, the size should be (avg key length) * (avg value length) * flushlogentries. Default 64MB.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.thread.splitcompactcheckfrequency
property.description: How often a region server runs the split/compaction check.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.nbreservationblocks
property.description: The number of reservation blocks which are used to prevent unstable region servers caused by an OOME.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.globalMemcache.upperLimit
property.description: Maximum size of all memcaches in a region server before new updates are blocked and flushes are forced. Defaults to 40% of heap.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.globalMemcache.lowerLimit
property.description: When memcaches are being forced to flush to make room in memory, keep flushing until we hit this mark. Defaults to 30% of heap. This value equal to hbase.regionserver.globalmemcache.upperLimit causes the minimum possible flushing to occur when updates are blocked due to memcache limiting.

property.name: hbase.hbasemaster.maxregionopen
property.description: Period to wait for a region open. If regionserver takes longer than this interval, assign to a new regionserver.

property.name: hbase.server.thread.wakefrequency
property.description: Time to sleep in between searches for work (in milliseconds). Used as sleep interval by service threads such as META scanner and log roller.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.safemode.period
property.description: Time to wait on regionserver startup before beginning compactions and memcache flushes.

property.name: hbase.hregion.memcache.flush.size
property.description: A HRegion memcache will be flushed to disk if size of the memcache exceeds this number of bytes. Value is checked by a thread that runs every hbase.server.thread.wakefrequency.

property.name: hbase.hregion.memcache.block.multiplier
property.description: Block updates if memcache has hbase.hregion.block.memcache time hbase.hregion.flush.size bytes. Useful preventing runaway memcache during spikes in update traffic. Without an upper-bound, memcache fills such that when it flushes the resultant flush files take a long time to compact or split, or worse, we OOME.

property.name: hbase.hregion.max.filesize
property.description: Maximum HStoreFile size. If any one of a column families' HStoreFiles has grown to exceed this value, the hosting HRegion is split in two. Default: 256M.

property.name: hbase.hstore.compactionThreshold
property.description:
If more than this number of HStoreFiles in any one HStore (one HStoreFile is written per flush of memcache) then a compaction is run to rewrite all HStoreFiles files as one. Larger numbers put off compaction but when it runs, it takes longer to complete. During a compaction, updates cannot be flushed to disk. Long compactions require memory sufficient to carry the logging of all updates across the duration of the compaction.
If too large, clients timeout during compaction.

property.name: hbase.hstore.compaction.max
property.description: Max number of HStoreFiles to compact per 'minor' compaction.

property.name: hbase.hregion.majorcompaction
property.description: The time (in miliseconds) between 'major' compactions of all HStoreFiles in a region. Default: 1 day.

property.name: hbase.regions.slop
property.description: Rebalance if regionserver has average + (average * slop) regions. Default is 10% slop.

property.name: hbase.io.index.interval
property.description: The interval at which we record offsets in hbase store files/mapfiles. Default for stock mapfiles is 128. Index files are read into memory. If there are many of them, could prove a burden. If so play with the hadoop io.map.index.skip property and skip every nth index member when reading back the index into memory. Downside to high index interval is lowered access times.

property.name: hbase.io.seqfile.compression.type
property.description: The compression type for hbase sequencefile.Writers such as hlog.

property.name: hbase.hstore.blockCache.blockSize
property.description: The size of each block in the block cache. Enable blockcaching on a per column family basis; see the BLOCKCACHE setting in HColumnDescriptor. Blocks are kept in a java Soft Reference cache so are let go when high pressure on memory. Block caching is not enabled by default.

property.name: hbase.hash.type
property.description: The hashing algorithm for use in HashFunction. Two values are supported now: murmur (MurmurHash) and jenkins (JenkinsHash).
